meanings.definition: The ability of a material to be stretched or drawn out without breaking.
meanings.sent1: The metal's ductility allowed it to be stretched into a thin wire.
meanings.sent2: The ductility of the clay made it easy to shape into different forms.
meanings.sent3: The ductility of the rubber band made it a great candidate for a silly slingshot.
meanings.sent4: Her patience and ductility were like a rubber band, always adapting to new situations.
meanings.sent5: The ductility of the dough made it perfect for molding into various shapes.

meanings.definition: The quality of being easily molded or shaped.
meanings.sent1: The artist admired the ductility of the clay as he sculpted a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The ductility of the plastic allowed it to be molded into intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The ductility of the playdough made it a fun toy for the children to shape and reshape.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity and ductility in problem-solving were like clay, always finding new solutions.
meanings.sent5: The ductility of the fabric made it perfect for creating flowing dresses.
